channel.title: Boston Women in Bioinformatics's Events
channel.description: Stay updated with our upcoming events and meetups

item.title: Byte and Bite: Bioinformatics Lunch Meetup
item.content:encoded:
When: Friday, November 7, 2025 at 12:00 PM

Where: CanalSide Food & Drink, CambridgeSide, 100 Cambridgeside Pl, Cambridge, Massachusetts

Are you a bioinformatics enthusiast looking to meet and mingle with fellow professionals in a relaxed and unscripted environment? Join us for a Bioinformatics Networking Lunch, an informal gathering where great conversations, shared ideas, and new connections are on the menu!

What to Know Before You Register

  • This gathering is intended for individuals who identify as women. üë©‚Äçüî¨
  • Each guest will be responsible for purchasing their own meal and/or beverages. üçΩÔ∏è

How to find us

We‚Äôll be gathering at the CambridgeSide Mall food court, a lively and accessible spot right in the heart of East Cambridge. If you're taking the MBTA Green Line, hop off at Lechmere Station‚Äîit‚Äôs just a short walk to the mall entrance. Driving in? The mall offers plenty of garage parking with flexible hourly rates and extended hours, so you‚Äôll have no trouble finding a spot.

‚ÄãOnce inside, head toward Chilacates‚Äîwe‚Äôll be nearby! The food court features a variety of dining options, so feel free to grab a bite, explore, and settle in.

item.title: GitHub Basics 2
item.content:encoded:
When: Thursday, November 13, 2025 at 5:30 PM

Where: Boynton Yards, Somerville, MA

Ready to level up your GitHub skills? GitHub Basics 2 builds on the foundations from our first session and dives deeper into collaborative coding skills like:

  • Branching and pull requests
  • Resolving merge conflicts
  • Using issues and discussions to communicate code changes

This is a hands-on, beginner-friendly workshop designed to help you gain confidence with GitHub workflows, whether you‚Äôre contributing to open source, managing your own projects, or collaborating with a team. A basic understanding of making commits and working with remotes is required. If you didn't attend our first GitHub basics workshop, please review the material for making commits here and working with remotes here.

Parking is $10 at Boynton yards if you park after 5pm, and there may be street parking on Cambridge street or other nearby streets
